Jumping Jacks.desc: It is a physical jumping exercise performed by jumping to a position with the legs spread wide and the hands going overhead, sometimes in a clap, and then returning to a position with the feet together and the arms at the sides.

Skipping.desc: Skipping is a form of exercise that involves swinging a rope around your body and jumping over it as it passes under your feet

Windwill Toe Touch.desc: It involves standing on the toes and arms extended with palms facing forward, turning around to touch the opposite toe with the hand and then returning to the starting position.

Tuck Jumps.desc: It is a progression upon the bodyweight squat jump that entails a lifter to tuck their legs up into the chest once in flight, then fully place them back into the landing position each and every jump

Plank Shoulder Taps.desc: It involves holding a plank position while simultaneously tapping your opposite shoulders.

High Knees.desc: It Involves running in place while lifting one knee up towards the chest at a time, alternating between both legs

Side Shuffle.desc: It involves moving side-to-side on one foot while maintaining a steady rhythm with your arms.

Lateral Side step.desc: This exercise involves quickly stepping to the side while shifting your weight in the opposite direction.

Shuttle Runs.desc: It involves starting a line and sprinting to the finish line and back.
